page.title: 15DIPTFORDS SPEECH
page.content: The Devonshire {Dialect} is a complicated one to speak, but sadly the accent is disappearing from our language because people are coming down from Scotland and other Counties and bringing their own {accents} into the area. So now it is mainly the old who speak with a Devonshire accent. Some of the young people do speak with a true Devonshire accent because they come from families with strong accents. The people who are true Devonians speak the Dialect in the true way. Many words are different and not easily understood. Every effort is being made to make sure we keep our dialect by the formation of Devonshire Dialect {Societies.}
